e2b47b8a-ae15-4c93-aef2-57bd905b0081.label: Trooper of Troop K (1916), Lincoln Motion Picture Company

4a8af557-9489-4cf1-97df-413adb39f194.label: Trooper of Troop K (1916), Lincoln Motion Picture Company

children.text: is a 1921 film from the Lincoln Motion Picture Company, one of the earliest Black filmmaking companies in the U.S. It stars Clarence Brooks and Anita Thompson and was directed by Harry A. Gant. It is a 35mm film.

The Trooper of Troop K (1916) is the second film from the Lincoln Motion Picture Company, one of the earliest Black filmmaking companies in the U.S. Found titled as both The Trooper of Troop K and The Trooper of Company K, this extant footage is the earliest surviving footage from a Black filmmaker in existence. In 2023, Dr. Cara Caddoo used materials from the George P. Johnson Negro Film Collection at UCLA to identify this footage that was included in the print of By Right of Birth (1921), also from the Lincoln Company.

label: By Right of Birth (1921) and Trooper of Troop K (1916)
